  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51694].
  {panel}

This would make it easier to read slide decks with the viewer. The page up and page down keys have two problems:
 * the scrolling tends to be animated, rather than instant ^
 * they never scroll the document by exactly one page

The vertical arrow keys are currently taken for small movements, and the horizontal ones are taken for switching between attachments, so you could use vi(1) keys (“j” and “k”) plus buttons for mouse users (in the .cp-toolbar).

There are three workarounds (that I know of):
 * go full screen → use the vertical arrow keys
 * download → open the attachment in the user’s own viewer
 * paper clip → one of the “view” links → use the buttons there
 ** horizontal arrow keys work there, if you go full screen
 ** this workaround requires the user to leave the page

^ depending on the user’s browser and OS configuration
fields.summary: attachment viewer: give users a pair of keys to scroll by exactly a page

h3. Summary
When users with spaces in their usernames are sync'd into Confluence from an external directory (e.g. Active Directory), they are unable to reset their password due to the following error:
bq. The following error(s) occurred: User with username 'FirstName' does not exist.

h3. How to replicate
# Set up a mail server with Confluence..
# Sync a user directory containing a user whose username is in the following format: "FirstName LastName", whereby there is a space that separates the two names. For example, "Jonathan Soo".
# Logout and click on "Forgot your password?" on the login page.
# Enter your username or e-mail address into the field and click on "Send it to me".
# Check your e-mail for an e-mail from Confluence and click on the "Reset Password" button in the e-mail.
# Enter your new password twice and click on "Reset".

h3. Expected results
The password should be successfully changed.

h3. Actual results
We see the following error for the user "Jonathan Soo".

 !Reset password.png|thumbnail!

h3. Problem Definition

In the Single Page App navigation :

- When a user is on a page and the space homepage link is clicked in the global sidebar, the user will land on the space homepage with the Page tab opened.
- When a user is on a blog and the space homepage link is clicked in the global sidebar, the user will land on the space homepage with the Blog tab opened.

The user has to do an extra click to open the Overview tab and see the actual space homepage content configured for the space.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the space homepage link configurable, so users can choose whether to open the Overview tab or the Page/Blog tab.

h3. Why this is important

Customers can have the option to take advantage of the Overview content over the Page Tab or Blog Tab.
 
h3. Workaround 

Use the space link on the side to land in the Overview Tab of the Space homepage.

 !side link.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Make the space homepage link configurable

h3. Summary
When a link to an anchor is created, the subsequent attempt to edit a page causes the link to change its name to {{<page title>#<anchor link name>}}. 

Note: This can only be replicated while Collaborative Editing is set to 'On' or 'Limited' and can be hardly replicated in new pages.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Import this space backup (space key: TEST):  [^Confluence-space-export-160823-2.xml.zip]
# View the page 'the lion king'. You'll see at the bottom of the page that there's anchor link named 'top' that brings you to the top of the page once you click on it.
# Edit the page 'the lion king'.
# Scroll to the bottom of the page editor.

h3. Expected results
The anchor link should not change from the original link name 'top'.

h3. Actual results
The anchor link has changed from 'top' to 'the lion king#top'.
An error message stating that you are viewing a previous version of the page also appears at the top of the page when the anchor is clicked.

This behavior also exists when a page containing a link to an anchor is copied using (...) > Copy. For these pages, this behavior exists regardless of whether the original page was corrected or not. When the broken link on the copied page is clicked, the error message mentioned above does not display.
fields.summary: An anchor link's name changes after editing the page with Collaborative Editing switched on or set to limited

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When using the Task Report macro, you must specify a specific space or page from which to pull the tasks. If a user is adding the Task Report macro to a space or page template, this can pose a problem because no specific spaces or pages are specified. This pulls in all tasks from any space/page.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for the use of variables in this macro, like {{$spacKey}} so that the template will pull only tasks from that space. Or allow a blank entry in the *Space(s) and Page(s)* box to default to the current space. 
h3. Why this is important

This is important to maintaining consistency in pages created through a template with this macro.
h3. Workaround

When using the template, the user will need to update that macro to pull data from the correct space/page.
fields.summary: Allow the use of space variables in the Task Report Macro

h3. Summary

When creating a new page in Confluence 5.10.8 by choosing "Import from Word", certain content shows up in the page as <ac:structured-macro ac:name="unmigrated-wiki-markup" ac:schema-version="1" ac:macro-id="55da6a31-0442-4c6e-bd02-5f890e7d4883"> <ac:plain-text-body><![CDATA[ and everything in the table shifts over one column to the right. This same document imports fine in 5.8.18.
h3. Environment

Confluence 5.10.8 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence 5.10.8,or 6.0.5, create a new test page.
 # Edit the page and choose "Import Word Document." Import the Word document Final Import File.docx. (This file was created in Word 2013 in Windows 7 and attached to this ticket)
 # Choose Replace for Where to import and Replace for Title conflicts. Choose Level 1 headings for Split by heading and choose Import.
 # Go to the second page created, ESA.0002, and the second table. The second row has <ac:structured-macro ac:name="unmigrated-wiki-markup" ac:schema-version="1" ac:macro-id="55da6a31-0442-4c6e-bd02-5f890e7d4883"> <ac:plain-text-body><![CDATA[.

h3. Expected Results

I expect the Word document to create the pages with the proper tables and data in each cell.
h3. Actual Results

Certain content shows up in cells as <ac:structured-macro ac:name="unmigrated-wiki-markup" ac:schema-version="1" ac:macro-id="55da6a31-0442-4c6e-bd02-5f890e7d4883"> <ac:plain-text-body><![CDATA[ and everything in the table shifts over one column to the right.

The logs show:

\{code:borderStyle=solid}2017-03-07 16:04:40,070 INFO [http-nio-8080-exec-9] [render.xhtml.migration.ErrorReportingV2Renderer] render Unable to render content on page null:null
 Wrapping content in unmigrated wiki markup macro due to system error: String index out of range: -1\{code}
h3. Notes
 * Copied/pasted the document into a new Word 2011 for Mac document - same issue.
 * Copied pasted the content of the table affected into a new table - issue did not happen.
 * Removed content in cell before and after the error - same issue.
 * Removed all headers in the table - same issue.
 * Removed all special characters (colons, semi-colons, #) - same issue.
 * Chose Edit after the import completed, there are no macros on the page except an anchor macro, removed the anchor macro - same issue.
 * Tried running the wikiToXhtmlMigrationUpgradeTask, went back to the page and still see the same error.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. When the issue occurs if you edit the page and delete the error in the cell, the remaining cells that shifted one to the right do not move back and that is why the bug is marked as major. Please see see if you need access to the Word document to reproduce the issue.
fields.summary: Importing From Word Does not Properly Convert to XHTML

Simple user macro allows a user to select a variable from list works fine when user wants to only select one item from the dropdown. However, when he try to add the multiple eattribute to allow users to select more than one item from list, macro fails.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51595].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Confluence doesn't have a way to expire drafts. It is very unlikely that drafts older than a few weeks will ever be used and they may be forgotten if the 'drafts' page are not accessed.

Also, the drafts keep the attachments added to it, so they can take a lot of disk space.

There were cases where users were unable to generate Confluence Cloud backups because of the size of attachments. More than half of all attachments were associated to drafts, over 200GB.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the following options, with a specific page this configuration:
# A configuration for expiry draft dates (say, remove every drafts after 30 days with no modification)
#* We can keep this option as disabled by default, so by default Confluence continues to work as it does
# An option to run immediately a job to delete all drafts that are older than a specific date, if the customer has the need to decrease the size of drafts
# Provide information on draft space usage.
 
h3. Workaround 
There a [REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-server-rest-api] call to delete drafts:
{code}
curl -D- -u <user>:<password> -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X DELETE <URL>/rest/api/content/<ID>?status=draft
{code}
fields.summary: Draft expiry tools

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a JIRA gadget (3rd party or an Atlassian gadget) is loaded in Confluence 6 users receive the error "There was error when performing your request. Please retry or go to other page." if the gadget retrieval takes over 5 seconds to load.
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.X
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect Confluence 6.X to JIRA.
 # Create a new page and add a JIRA gadget on the page.
 # Navigate to the newly created page.

h3. Expected Results

The gadget always loads when the page is viewed.

The gadget/macro will respect the timeouts listed in General Configuration -> Connection Timeouts
h3. Actual Results

The page loads but the gadget displays the error "There was error when performing your request. Please retry or go to other page."

This will only happen if it takes over 5 seconds to retrieve the gadget. Many customers have pages that can take over 5 seconds to load when fetching gadgets from JIRA.
h3. Notes

The default socket timeout has been reduced from 15 seconds in Confluence 5.10.8 to 5 seconds in Confluence 6.X, even though the intent of HttpTimeoutsProvider was to provide a 15 second socket timeout. Under Confluence 6, the same method in HttpClientFetcher requests the configured connection timeout and accidentally sets that connection timeout as the socket timeout.
h3. Workaround

Add the JVM parameter:
{code:java}
-Datlassian.http.connection.timeout=xxxx{code}
.
 (!) If you're running Confluence Data Center, please do ensure to add this parameter in *all* of your Confluence nodes.
fields.summary: Jira gadgets and macros timeout after 5 seconds in Confluence

h3. Summary

When creating a "create from template" button, the template doesn't matter, and set a default page name this issue occurs. The issue appears to be that if you use the macro to create a page and do not change the default page name, then the next time you run the macro it will target the existing page with that name, rather than creating a new page. This results in the existing page getting overwritten.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a blank page, insert a "create from template" macro on it, the template doesn't matter, set a default title for the page.

1. Create a page from a template using the macro button.
2. Do not modify the page name
3. Modify any other content on the page (remember what you changed)
4. Save the page
5. Create some child pages
6. Create a page from a template again using macro
7. This time, change the name
8. Save the page
9. Notice that the page created in Step 4 has been renamed and its content replaced by the page created in Step 8. Child items of the page from Step 4 are now child items of the page from Step 8.
h3. Expected Results

Confluence shouldn't overwrite the first page, it should rename the new page for like "default1, default2"
h3. Actual Results

Confluence is overwriting the original page create by the macro.
fields.summary: Create page with "Create from Template Macro" using a Default page title causes data loss

h3. Summary

When increasing the frequency of health checks from 24 hours to 1 hour it was observed that notifications were repeatedly sent, even if they were marked as read.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Increase the frequency of the health check job, or wait for several failures over time to occur (this can take a few days currently as the health check execution is every 24 hours).
# Mark do not notify again on failure for notifications.

h3. Expected Results

If a check has been marked as read, it should not appear again unless it has passed and then failed again.

h3. Actual Results

When a check fails, then is marked as read, the notification can appear again on the next run. This doesn't happen consistently, so is hard to accurately reproduce.

h3. Notes

It appears the logic we use to update the status in the database is not taking into account certain things, so additional statuses for the same job are incorrectly added, causing the additional notifications to appear.
fields.summary: Instance Health plugin fires additional notifications for health checks that have already failed

h3. Summary

h3. Environment

Confluence 6.1 (currently unreleased).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Browse to the Instance Health Page
# Wait for health checks to complete

h3. Expected Results

As each check completes it is updated periodically to the page (as they run in an executor of 8 threads)

h3. Actual Results

The page waits until the one long running check (end of life in this case as 6.1 is unreleased) to complete until the other checks are updated in the page.

h3. Notes

It appears this is because we put all the checks into one 'process' and run them sequentially rather than in parallel as per the the intended design.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51524].
  {panel}

Hi,

Following the changes to the Confluence sidebar last night, I can no longer see the Page Tree without clicking on the Home Page, clicking on Pages, clicking on a Page - then the Page Tree sidebar opens up (next to the new sidebar) - where previously I could configure it as part of the sidebar by default. I'm also finding when I go to another space, and then come back, I need to step through the additional clicks to get back to the Page Tree.

The changes have also introduced white space which is forcing additional page scrolling that now means what we could see on one page before, now we need to scroll down.

Support told me that the changes were intended to 'streamline the experience' but I'm not sure how the changes have achieved this when they introduced extra clicks and page scrolling.

Also, as my team is constantly using the tool all day, every day, the additional icons to track "my work" are not helpful as we typically look-up, create and edit many pages each day, therefore "recently worked on" and "recently visited" doesn't serve as a quick access tool. It also doesn't help my users who need to search the page tree or use search to find the pages in the first place.

It would be great if the changes could be reconsidered to accommodate the feedback from users who are using Confluence on a daily basis as their key work tool rather than assuming the pain points and then modifying the user's experience to something less effective.

Cheers,

Bonnie
fields.summary: Changes to Confluence sidebar / page tree don't streamline the user experience

When a user loads team calendars for the first time they get this:

http://cl.ly/image/2I3V1I210O0V

With the assumption that most know start with their country rather than their timezone offset, we should change the display formatting of this dialog so its "Country/City (Timezone)"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51414].
  {panel}

We introduced this message when the user has hit the JIRA issue limit:
http://cl.ly/image/3Y3z2J1n2B0L

I've had a lot of feedback internally that the error message is confusing. Some problems:

1. We don't tell the user what we've done - we only show 1,000 issues, but which 1,000?
Suggestion: 
* Remove the text "Error(s) occurred" change to 
{quote}
"Oops! We've found an some issues with your JIRA calendars: 
* Confluence JIRA release calendar is very large. We've limited the number of events to 1,000 for performance reasons. <LINK>Edit the JIRA calendar</LINK> to reduce the number of events returned."
{quote}
\\

2. It looks like a very strong error message, when in reality it isn't too bad of an error. 
Suggestion: 
* This should be a yellow AUI box, not a red one. 
* In addition, it should be dismissible - you should be able to acknowledge the notice and not see it come up again every time - an "x" up the top left?

Is there anything else we can do to improve this experience?
fields.summary: Improve the JIRA (1,000 issue) and event calendar (200 events) limit experience

fields.description:
UI Ticket here [UI-1284|See https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/UI-1284]

Here's the problem:
A user can be watching a calendar if that calendar is embeded in a page they are watching. If an event gets added to a calendar embedded in a page they are watching, they get an email notification that looks something like this:
!https://img.skitch.com/20110718-xigrnj854qy54gmbpmqxp39dm6.png!

They go to look at the calendar and see there's no watch on it:
!https://img.skitch.com/20110718-1qy1c9qcy7aqkmbnu9drbm6pmg.png!

Ideally the email notification would indicate why they're receiving that notification. 

As an added benefit, the user might be able to go to an "information" tab about the calendar to see what pages that calendar is embedded into.
fields.summary: Users want to know why they are receiving email notifications from Team Calendars
